author: sky.cactus
content: What is the plan for submitting 1559 transactions over JSON-RPC?

author: sky.cactus
content: Were we going to introduce a new method for `sendTransaction`, or just overload the existing one?

author: sky.cactus
content: <@135612611923279872> makes a good point at https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/rfc-signer-feature-detection-over-json-rpc/5773/3 that overloading an existing method makes it very difficult for wallets to identify whether or not the node they are speaking to supports 1559 transactions or not.

author: sky.cactus
content: e.g., right now they would have to hard code Ropsten to have support while Kovan does not have support and then have that change at some point in the future.

author: sky.cactus
content: If we introduce a new `eth_sendTransactionWithMaxFee` then they can (in theory) just detect whether that method is supported or not.

content: London *has* to happen in July.  Whether 1559 gets included or not is still a bit up in the air but I think it probably will make it.

author: halfinney.
content: got it. If it does not make it in London, will there be a special HF to implement it or would it be targeted directly for Shanghai?

author: halfinney.
content: Well, if 1559 does not make it, then it would just be the difficulty bomb push out, right?
